Title: Tinubu sends 32 additional ambassadorial nominees to Senate
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has forwarded 32 additional ambassadorial nominees to the Senate for confirmation, just days after submitting an initial batch of three names . In two separate letters to Senate President Godswill Akpabio, the President urged the upper chamber to confirm the nominees .

Title: Amorim says Manchester United must be club of ‘no excuses’
Summary: Ruben Amorim insists Manchester United must be club of ‘no excuses’ given the enduring demands for success at Old Trafford . The English giants suffered a poor first season under the Portuguese manager and made a faltering start to the season .

Title: 96 arrested for violating sanitation law in Nasarawa
Summary: Nasarawa State Government says it has apprehended 96 persons for violating environmental sanitation laws across the 13 local government areas of the state . Abubakar Mohammed, Chief Prosecutor Officer, revealed this while briefing journalists immediately .

Title: Yuletide: C’River govt orders closure of 8 Miles roadside markets
Summary: Cross River State Government has intensified sanitary measures across the state, including the closure of 8 Miles roadside markets . As part of preparations for the Yuletide celebrations and Carnival Calabar 2025, the state government, through the Ministry of Environment, has intensified Sanitary measures .

Title: Cross River clears 500 entrepreneurs for single-digit SME loans
Summary: Cross River State Government clears 500 entrepreneurs for single-digit SME loans . The state Microfinance and Enterprise Development Agency (CRSMEDA) cleared 500 entrepreneurs to access the SMEDAN–Sterling Bank single digit interest loan facility . The step is a step toward strengthening the state's small business ecosystem .

Title: Luiz Diaz late show helps Bayern rebound from Arsenal loss
Summary: Luis Diaz scored in stoppage time to help Bayern Munich bounce back from Wednesday's Champions League loss to Arsenal in a 3-1 comeback home win over St Pauli on Saturday .

Title: Ousted Guinea-Bissau president arrives in Congo – Report
Summary: The true motives for the coup in Guinea-Bissau remain unclear, with speculation and conspiracy theories circulating . Conspiracy theories include that the coup was carried out with Embalo's blessing .

Title: Amorim says Manchester United must be club of ‘no excuses’
Summary: Ruben Amorim insists Manchester United must be club of 'no excuses' given the enduring demands for success at Old Trafford . Amorims insists United need to be a club of "no excuses" given the demands of success at the club .

Title: Tinubu pledges better equipment, training for Police as new cadets graduate
Summary: Tinubu pledges investment in modern equipment, enhanced training and improved logistics for the Nigeria Police . President restated his determination to strengthen the nation’s security architecture .

Title: We’ll work tirelessly to tackle root causes of insecurity – Tinubu
Summary: Tinubu commended the police academy for providing world-class training and education that empowers the officers to serve with integrity, courage and compassion . He said we’ll work tirelessly to tackle root causes of insecurity .

Title: Police foil bandits' attack in Katsina, recover guns
Summary: The Katsina State Police Command says it has foiled a bandit attack along the Kandawa‑Dankar road in Batsari Local Government Area, recovering two AK‑47 rifles, 24 rounds of live ammunition, and a Boxer motorcycle . The spokesman of the command, DSP Abubakar Sadiq, in

Title: Tinubu reaffirms support as 1,187 police cadets graduate in Kano
Summary: President Bola Tinubu attended the Passing Out Parade of 1,187 graduating cadets of the Nigeria Police Academy in Wudil, Kano State . He praised the Academy for its growth into a degree-awarding institution and lauded its role in producing officers equipped to tackle Nigeria’s evolving security challenges .

Title: Malaria now a rare disease in Lagos – Health commissioner
Summary: Lagos State Health Commissioner Prof Akin Abayomi has said malaria has become a rare disease in Lagos . He has also urged residents to question diagnoses and avoid unnecessary medications . He also criticised the common “malaria-typhoid” diagnosis, calling it a “double jeopardy” that often leads to unnecessary treatments

Title: Ogun CJ urges judges to prioritise sexual violence cases
Summary: The Chief Judge of Ogun State, Justice Mosunmola Dipeolu, urged the judiciary to eliminate all forms of delay and prioritise accelerated hearing of cases of sexual violence . She made the call while delivering her keynote address titled “Strengthening Legal Pathways for Survivors of Sexual Violence” at a day-

Title: FULL LIST: Ambassadors-designate nominated by Tinubu
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has forwarded the names of 32 ambassadorial nominees to the Senate for confirmation . Nominees include 17 non-career ambassadors and 15 career ambassadors . The nominees are expected to be posted to strategic countries, including China, India, South Korea, Canada, Mexico, UAE, Qatar, South Africa,
